titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the John Prentice Allen Papers 1918-1992
titlestmt.author: Bill Huntington

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-04-07.
profiledesc.descrules: Finding aid based on DACS (Describing Archives: A Content Standard), 2nd Edition.

change.item: Edited by Zoe Henderson for compliance with DACS and WCNA Required Elements for Archival Description.

did.abstract: The John Prentice Allen Paper, which date from 1930 to 1979, contains correspondence, travel brochures and concert programs, work-related records, and documents relating to military service.
did.langmaterial: Collection is in English and Japanese.

acqinfo.p: Donated to the Whitman College and Northwest Archives between 1985 and 1992 by John P. Allen. The accession number associated with this donation is Retro-0759.

bioghist.p: John Prentice Allen was born November 26, 1918, in Seattle, Washington to Rudolph and Anna Farrar Allen. He attended schools in Seattle and Aberdeen, Washington and graduated from Roosevelt High School in Seattle in 1936. He attended Whitman College, the University of Hawaii at Honolulu, the University of Colorado at Boulder, and the University of Kentucky at Lexington. He was a clerical worker at Whitman College from 1946 to 1950. He received a bachelor's degree from the University of Washington, and in 1952 received a master's degree in librarianship from the University of Washington. John also served during World War II in the U.S. Navy as a Japanese language officer. He was a librarian at Central Washington University in Ellensburg between 1952 and 1965, when he moved to Washington State University. He retired in 1981. He was a co-owner of the Hilltop Restaurant and Motel at Pullman. He died June 25, 1991.

scopecontent.p: The John Prentice Allen Papers includes correspondence between John and his parents and friends, and material describing travel and entertainment experiences. This collection, which dates from 1930 through 1979, also holds records of his career in library administration, genealogical materials relating to his family, and Japanese language materials relating to his service in the U.S. Navy during World War II.
The majority of this series is correspondence between Allen and his parents, Rudolph and Anna.

scopecontent.p: Materials relating to John Allen's educational career, including high school and college yearbooks and a draft of his master thesis from the University of Washington. Records from his library career at Central Washington State and Washington State Universities are included.

scopecontent.p: Some material included in this series is foreign language material relating to Allen's work in the military translating Japanese.
